intro: Kerneria coreopsoides, commonly known as the yellow coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Kerneria coreopsoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
